TitleStudy: Deposition of Mercury in Forests along a Montane Elevation gradient
Vegetation: Sugar Mapple, Yellow Birch, Red Maple, American Beech
MethodLitterfall: two plastic crates lined with plastic mesh in each plot left in the field year-round - collection twice a year late Nov. and early May 2009 -2011
MethodThroughfall: 4-inch PVC pipe into the ground. The pipe functioned as a housing and shielded the throughfall samples from sunlight. Throughfall gauges were also constructed at each site by attaching a 15 cm polyethylene funnel to a 4L collecting bottle. Throughfall was collected three to four times throughout the growing season and was sampled for an interval between 10-30 days depending on rainfall quantities over the collection period

MethodThroughfall: glass funnel protected by PVC casing, drained into a glass bottle buried into soil to keep the sample cool - throughfall measured under spruce and collected monthly
Flag: study conducted over 2020-2022 but trees infested in 2021 so we collected 2020-2021 period for litterfall and 2020-2022 for throughfall
